title: Yasuo: Ideas for Windwall Change
body:
Yasuo is supposed to be a high skill-cap champion, so why does he have a simple instant "nullify most incoming damage" ability that really doesn't take much skill to use to great effect? 

With that preface, I have a few ideas in how to change {{champion:157}} 's windwall to be more fitting his skill curve:

1) **Give it an animation a slightly longer wind-up/cast time.**  This would add the need for some thought to be put in as to when he should use it, instead of it being instant, with little thought being needed to make it effective.  This idea was not my own, credit [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/r3NcPEw3-my-thoughts-on-yasuos-wind-wall).

2) **Make it only work one way, as the animation implies.**  Again, instead of him just being able to dash in and out of the animation, he would actually need to plan out where he wants to go.

3) **Give it a limit to how much it blocks, or reduce the time it is up.**  Windwall can last almost an entire teamfight, if the burst is right, forcing the ranged to move into dangerous melee range (if they aren't already dead from yasuo's bursty ult).  Perhaps 5 autos and abilities would be fair, still being strong, but not completely game-breaking.

4) **Make it block his own team's abilities and attacks.**  While this is unlikely to happen as it might require too much planning and coordination, there is a precedent behind this with Anivia's and Jarvan's walls preventing allied champion movement as well as enemy.   

Of course, doing all those would be overkill, but one or a combination could really help to balance his kit out with the rest of league.  Disclaimer: no, I didn't just face a Yasuo and came to the forums to complain, just giving the ideas that I've mulled over for a while :)

Bonus round:
His ult.  As a support main, I find it incredibly annoying trying to keep my carries alive when he ults, because he can't be interrupted by being knocked away, stunned, etc.  The lack of counter is incredibly frustrating.  I feel that he should be able to be interrupted, breaking the knockup/stun component, but maybe letting the damage finish so it wouldn't make him essentially useless.

Merry Christmas, everyone!

replies.body:
These are very nice ideas that have been bounced around since Yasuo became a thing. Sadly, time has not made these ideas any better. Most of them have significant flaws, so I'll give you the short version of why.

1. Yasuo's skillcap has absolutely nothing to do with how that sort of ablity works. Tryndamere's Undying Rage, Fiora's Riposte, Yi's Alpha Strike, Braum's Unbreakable, Sivir's Spell Shield; none of these abilities have windup times. Know why? Because they're meant to save your skin in the heat of a fight. Delaying this sort of ability makes it significantly weaker. No.

2. This one is the least objectionable one, but also does the least for the abilities power, and thus would do very little to it. Not only does Windwall not need to be toned down, but even if it was, this is not the way to do so.

3. The potential impact of Yasuo's W is where a significant portion of where his budget has gone. It allows him to have a fallback pattern in case his laning goes to shit, and thus not have him be useless in teamfights. If you give the wall damage limitations, then you've made it pretty well useless in a lot of cases. It would die almost instant to Lucian's, MF's, and Syndra's ult, not to mention things are simple as Ziggs's Minefield. Windwall is not meant to be an ablative shield; it's a damage nullifier. Because of that, lowering how long it stays up could allow it to still block big abilities, but still render it a lot less useful. This is a place to potentially hit its power (that doesn't need to be hit), but the time lowered would have to be pretty small to let it still be an effective ability.

4.  Anivia's and Jarvan's abilties create terrain. Windwall is not a terrain construct. These spells are wholly distinct and thus comparisons and precedents do not apply. The abilities that are mechanically closest to Windwall are Unbreakable and Riposte. You don't see them blocking ally abilities or attacks do you? No, of course not, because something that disruptive would have to be balanced by some truly earth-shattering power. Just no.

Lastly, you _**can**_ interrupt Yasuo's ult. Use your stuns, knockups, what have you during the ult animation and it stops. Also, it's not an ability that's meant to have a whole lot of counterplay. It already has limited use because of the airborne requirement; that's where the counterplay is.
